description:
Using the FlatDHCPManager...

The commands that del/add an IP address from a device to the bridge fail to run after nova revision 776 (execvp).

The following exception is reported in nova-network.log:

(nova): TRACE: ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
(nova): TRACE: Command: sudo ip addr del 172.19.0.3/17 brd 172.19.127.255 scope global dev tap0
(nova): TRACE: Exit code: 1
(nova): TRACE: Stdout: ''
(nova): TRACE: Stderr: 'Error: an inet prefix is expected rather than "172.19.0.3/17 brd 172.19.127.255 scope global".\n'

The attached patch resolves the issue. A list was getting passed into the execute function and interpreted incorrectly.

NOTE: After making this fix I was finally able to boot a running instance for the first time since the execvp branch merge.
title: ensure_bridge ip del/add commands fail (post execvp)
